Harvey Smith Ionstorm
Speech Synthesis and Dynamic Game Conversations: Imagine if the game could assess a situation based on a long series of relevant player inputs, string together some responses and construct a convincing verbal response using a speech synthesis system. Suddenly, vastly more interactivity is possible. Once again, instead of a few canned responses (provided by the designer), the game could allow for a much wider range of responses, games might someday be able to analyze voice input and formulate a conversation that never had to be written by a designer a conversation of much greater relevance to the player's actions. (And when speech synthesis is combined with true artificial intelligence, narrative games will finally become truly interactive.)
